department: College of Computing and Digital Media
biography:
Mehdi Mirakhorli has a M.Sc. and BS in computer science, and is currently a PhD Candidate at DePaul University with research background in software architecture design, requirements engineering and agile processes.


He worked for seven years as a software developer and designer on large, data-intensive, meteorological and health care systems.

He has been awarded the ACM SIGSOFT Distinguished Paper Award at the International Conference on Software Engineering (2011 and 2012). 

Mirakhorli is a member of the ACM and SIGSOFT. He has served on the Program Committee for the the First Workshop on Requirements Engineering for Systems, Services, and Systems of Systems (RES4) held at RE 2011, and as a reviewer for various conferences and journals including the IEEE Transactions on Software
Engineering (TSE).
